oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Clover rot (Sclerotinia trifolium) and Fusarium fungi in organic red clover in Finland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yli-Mattila, T.
Kalko, G.
Hannukkala, A.
Hakala, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sclerotinia trifolium is economically one of the most important pathogens of red clover in Europe and North America, while many Fusarium species can cause root rot in red clover in certain environmental conditions. During the years 2003-2004 S. trifolium was found only in the Northern and Eastern part of Finland, although in 1960's it was common everywhere in Finland.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Yli-Mattila, T.; Kalko, G.; Hannukkala, A. and Hakala, K. (2005) Clover rot (Sclerotinia trifolium) and Fusarium fungi in organic red clover in Finland. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 1 (1), p. 258.
